p: The signatures of population reconnection identified here, i.e., bimodality and temporal increase of variance of peaks in the SFS, are robust to population expansion (Figure G in File S1), alternative evolutionary and population dynamic models such as repeated bottlenecks, rapid extinction-recolonization dynamics, recurrent positive selection or highly skewed offspring distributions (Figure H in File S1). Moreover, the signature is distinct from the signature of a closely related model: the Isolation with Migration model (IM) (Figure I in File S1).
